channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found upside down. Upon inspection two of the four bottles had caps completely off and leaking from lids. PPE was used to clean spill and placed in salvage drum. DescribePack: Two of the four bottles had caps completely off and leaking from lids. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE was used to clean spill and placed in salvage drum.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Steel drum fell off NC belt onto the floor. Somehow was punctured at the bottom of the body caused leakage and it was also dented on the side. Spill was cleaned with proper PPE and placed in salvage drum. DescribePack: Was punctured with a hole at the bottom of the body caused leakage and it was also dented on the side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Spill was cleaned with proper PPE and placed in salvage drum.

item.title: Report E-2023110080
item.description:
Report E-2023110080

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 25, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured by a forklift and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged 55-gallon drum in one (1) 85-gallon overpack. HES utilized absorbents and hand tools to further remediate the site.

  • Description: X-2023100296- (SequenceEvent: Steel drum leaking from the top due to drop assumingly. Used proper PPE to clean spill and placed in salvage drum. DescribePack: Steel drum leaking from the top DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Used proper PPE to clean spill and placed in salvage drum. X-2023100297-SequenceEvent: Steel Drum was leaking from the top and bottom of seal. Slightly on the sides as well due to assumed drop. Used proper PPE to clean spill and placed in salvage drum. DescribePack: Steel Drum was leaking from the op and bottom of seal, Slightly on the sides as well. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Used proper PPE to clean spill and placed in salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2023100597
item.description:

  • City: BRASELTON

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: CORRODED AND DAMAGED BOX WAS FOUND ON THE DOCK. UPON INSPECTION, TWO OF THE PLASTIC BOTTLES INSIDES WERE LEAKING ALONG THE SEAL NEAR THE TOP OF THE CAPS/ LIDS. The CAPS WERE ALSO VERY LOOSE. ASSUMED TO BE DROPPED. PROPER PPE WAS USED TO CLEAN THE SPILL AND PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM. DescribePack: TWO OF THE PLASTIC BOTTLES INSIDES WERE LEAKING ALONG THE SEAL NEAR THE TOP OF THE CAPS/ LIDS. The CAPS WERE ALSO VERY LOOSE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PROPER PPE WAS USED TO CLEAN THE SPILL AND PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Trailer door was opened and notice the hazmat package at the front. Box was wet but was not sure if it was because of the hazmat or another package. A certified Ops Admin was called on radio to retrieve package and inspect. Package was placed in a plastic and hazmat bag. Hazmat was inspected and realized that package was wet because of internal damaaged. DescribePack: just wet box due to top loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: given to QA Ops Admin to retrieve and inspect.

item.title: Report X-2023081773
item.description:
Report X-2023081773

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-19
  • City: MARIETTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Aug 18th a package was discovered at the station during the PM sort that had no markings on the outside of the package. An employee under manager supervision was instructed to open the package and discovered five packages of UN3480 Lithium Ion Batteries, 9 inside the box. DG Admin instructed the employee to open the inner packages to determine if there was any contact info but there is not. At this point, we do not know who the shipper or consignee are for this shipment. The package is being held at the station pending disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023101114
item.description:
Report X-2023101114

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered in the unload. Package was leaking in the trailer when pulled out and set aside in a hazmat bin. DescribePack: Doesn't appear to have damage on the outside. One of the inner containers had a loose cap or broken cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately removed from the building and put in a hazmat container to keep it from employees
